senses.ex: They hold an annual conference in December.

Tips.title: Frequency Clue
Tips.description: Use 'annual' to stress the regularity of an event that occurs once each year.
Tips.example: The annual fundraiser is our main source of donations.

Tips.title: Planned Events
Tips.description: 'Annual' is often used for scheduled events with some level of importance or tradition.
Tips.example: The annual shareholders' meeting is in June.

Tips.title: Expectation Setting
Tips.description: 'Annual' can imply expectation of continuation in subsequent years.
Tips.example: We enjoyed the annual picnic, looking forward to the next.

senses.de: a book or magazine that is published once a year under the same title but with different contents
senses.ex: The school publishes an annual with highlights of the year.

Tips.title: Publication Regularity
Tips.description: 'Annual' indicates the regular publishing cycle of a book or magazine.
Tips.example: The writer contributed to the annual again this year.

Tips.title: Content Variation
Tips.description: Each edition of an annual publication has different content from past editions.
Tips.example: Fans eagerly await the sports annual for the latest stats.

Tips.title: Collector's Item
Tips.description: Annual publications may become collectibles due to their unique yearly content.
Tips.example: I have every comic book annual from the past decade.

senses.de: relating to a period of one year
senses.ex: The annual budget is set in January every year.

Tips.title: Time Frame Specific
Tips.description: When 'annual' is used as an adjective, it specifies a precise one-year period.
Tips.example: The company showed good annual growth.

Tips.title: Professional Context
Tips.description: 'Annual' is commonly used in business to discuss yearly financial or strategic activities.
Tips.example: Our annual report highlights the fiscal achievements.

senses.de: a plant that survives for only one growing season
senses.ex: Petunias and marigolds are examples of annuals.

Tips.title: Botanical Lifespan
Tips.description: In botany, 'annual' describes a plant that completes its life cycle in one year.
Tips.example: Plant annuals in spring for summer blooming.

Tips.title: Gardening Planning
Tips.description: Gardeners plant annuals for one season of flowers or vegetables.
Tips.example: Annuals like zinnias add color all summer.

Tips.title: Seed to Seed
Tips.description: Annual plants go from germination to producing seeds within a single year.
Tips.example: Sunflowers are annuals that grow quickly from seed to seed.

Anniversary.wordDefinition:
Anniversary refers to the date on which a particular event occurred in a previous year, such as a wedding anniversary or the anniversary of a historical event.

Anniversary is used to celebrate a specific event that happened on a particular date in the past, while annual describes something that happens once a year or is done every year.

Cyclic.wordDefinition:
Annual means occurring once a year, while cyclic means occurring in repetitive cycles. Annual is applicable when referring to events that happen every year, such as birthdays or holidays.

Cyclic is applicable when referring to events that happen in regular intervals, such as the seasons or the phases of the moon.

For example, the changing of the seasons is cyclic because it happens in predictable cycles every year, while Christmas is annual because it happens once a year.

Habitual.wordDefinition: Habitual refers to something that is done consistently or repeatedly, such as a habitual smoker or habitual exercise routine.

Perennial.wordDefinition:
Perennial refers to a plant that lasts for more than two years. These plants can bloom and produce seeds for many years.

Unlike annual plants, perennial plants do not need to be replanted every year.

Annual plants only last for one year, while perennial plants last for multiple years. Annual plants need to be replanted every year, while perennial plants do not.

Periodical.wordDefinition:
Annual means something that happens once a year. For example, an 'annual exam' means it takes place once every year. Periodical refers to something that happens regularly but not necessarily once a year.

For example, a magazine that comes out monthly or quarterly is considered a 'periodical.' An annual event happens once a year, while a periodical event happens regularly but not necessarily once a year.

Recur.wordDefinition:
Recur refers to something that happens repeatedly, regardless of the time interval. For example, if someone gets a headache every month, it could be said that the headache recurs on a monthly basis.

Annual is applicable when referring to something that happens once a year, while recur is applicable when referring to something that happens repeatedly, regardless of the time interval.

Successive.wordDefinition:
Annual refers to something that happens once a year or every year, while the word successive means something that happens one after another without any gaps in between.

For example, an annual event could be a yearly festival or celebration that occurs at the same time each year, while successive events could be a series of concerts or performances that happen on consecutive nights.

Annual refers to the frequency of an event, while successive refers to the sequence of events.

Year.wordDefinition:
Annual refers to something that happens every year, such as an annual event or an annual report.

It describes something that occurs on a regular basis, but only once per year.

Year refers to the period of time it takes for the Earth to make one orbit around the sun, which is approximately 365.24 days.

It is a unit of time that can be used to measure anything that lasts for that amount of time, such as a school year or a fiscal year.

Annual describes something that happens once a year, while year is a period of time that lasts for approximately 365.24 days.

quotes.Text: All cultures are different. Some commit genocide. Some are uniquely peaceful. Some frequent bathhouses in groups. Some don't show each other the soles of their shoes or like pictures taken of them. Some have enormous hunting festivals or annual stretches when nobody speaks. Some don't use electricity.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Casey Affleck

quotes.Text: I have warned many times about the guaranteed dangers of betting with your heart instead of your head - big darkness, soon come - but every once in a while you get a fair chance to have it both ways, and the annual NCAA basketball Tournament is one of them.

quotes.Name: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.Text: Big companies, which spend tens of billions of dollars annually on 'call centers' to take orders and provide customer support, increasingly rely on speech recognition not just to handle requests for information but to process customer orders.

quotes.Name: Alex Berenson

quotes.Text: My family moved around a lot, so I don't have any friends that I had all my life, but I did have annual trips back to Queens.

quotes.Text: The movies I cannot go without and that I watch annually are 'A Clockwork Orange,' 'Scarface' and 'Fantasia.

quotes.Text: Poor, dear, silly Spring, preparing her annual surprise!

quotes.Text: Where annual elections end where slavery begins.

quotes.Text: You do something annual every year, don't you?

quotes.Text: I make an eight-figure income annually.
